msContents.summary: This Nepalese paper manuscript contains the Saptavāra, the Mañjuśrīnāmasaṅgīti and the Daśabalastavastotra. The Saptavāra ‘Seven Days’ usually incorporates the Vasudhārā (substituted in this manuscript by the Vasundhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka), Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdayā, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī/Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. The Mañjuśrīnāmasaṅgīti is a popular Buddhist tantric work, which consists primarily of 162 verses associated with Mañjuśrī, the Bodhisattva of wisdom. The Daśabalastavastotra is a Buddhist hymn to the ten powers of an illuminated being. According to the colophon placed at the end of the Mañjuśrīnāmasaṅgīti, the manuscript was written in Kathmandu (Kāṣṭhamaṇḍapa), probably in the Tarumūla Mahāvihāra (written taramūdra), in 1663 CE, under the reign of Jayapratāpa Malla (1641-1674), and it was commissioned by a monk named Ratnasiṃha .

msItem.title: Saptavāra
msItem.rubric: [1r1, first codicological unit] $ oṃ namaḥ bhagavatya āryyavasudhārāyai || oṃ namo ratnayā ||
msItem.incipit: [1r1, first codicological unit] devyarūpi sarūpī ca ¦ [1r2] śaumyarūpī valapradā, vasudhāla vasudhārī ca, vasuśrī śrīkari varā || ^^ || dhara[1r2]nī dhāranidāntā, saraṇa %bhaktivatsarāḥ || prajñāpāramitādevī, prajñā śrī[1r3]burddhivarddhanī || @ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [4r2, first codicological unit] āryyavasundhārā nāmama,trottraṃ śa[4r3]takaṃ, burddhabhāsitaṃ, pari@samāptaṃ || ^^^ || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [4r3, first codicological unit] oṃ namo bhagavate [4r4] āryyavajavidālīni |
msItem.finalRubric: [7r5, first codicological unit] || ^^^ || iti āryavajavidyārana, nāma dhāraṇi¦[7v1]hṛdaya,prahṛdaya,mūlasūtraṃ samāptaṃ || ^^^ || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [7v1, first codicological unit] oṃ namaḥ ganapate hṛdayāya na[7v2]ma || oṃ namo ratnatayāya ||
msItem.finalRubric: [10v1, first codicological unit] || ^^ || āryyaga¦[10v2]napatihṛdayā nāma dhārani samāptaṃ || @ || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [10v2, first codicological unit] oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyauṣṇīkhavijayāyai ||
msItem.finalRubric: [16v4, first codicological unit] || ^^ || āryyaparnnaśavalī,mahāmārīpra¦[16v5]śamaṇi nāma dhārani samāpta || ^^^ || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [16v5, first codicological unit] oṃ namo bhagavate māriciyai ||
msItem.finalRubric: [19r3, first codicological unit] || ^^^ || ā[19r4]ryyamālci nāma dhāraṇī % samāptaṃ m iti || ^^^ || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [19r4, first codicological unit] oṃ namo bhagava[19r5]te grahamārtṛkāyai ||
msItem.explicit: [34v1, second codicological unit] || ^^^ || idaṃm avocat_ bhagavāṃn ātamanā te ca bhikṣava bo[34v2]dhisattvā sā ca sarvvāvatiparṣa sa ca devamānukhāsuragaruḍagardha[34v3]m ca roko bhagavato bhākhītam abhyanaṃdan iti || ^^^ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [34v1, second codicological unit] || ^^^ || āryyagrahamā[34v2]tṛkā nāma dhāranī samāpta || ^^^ || @ ||
msItem.explicit: [35r1, first codicological unit] ragā,gandharvva loko bhagavatvabhaṣitā,m abhyanansan itī || ^^^ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [35r1, first codicological unit] āryyagrahamātṛkā¦[23r2] nāma dhārani samāptaṃ % || ^^^ ||
msItem.colophon: [35r2, first codicological unit] je dharmā hetuprabhāvā, hertus teṣāṃ tathā¦[35r3]gata, hevas teṣāṃ ca jo ni%lodha evaṃvādi mahāśravanaḥ || ^^^ || @ || [35r4] ||

msItem.title: Mañjuśrīnāmasaṅgīti
msItem.rubric: [35r4, first codicological unit] oṃ namo mañjunāthāya ḥ %
msItem.incipit: [35r4, first codicological unit] atha vajradharaḥ śrīmān_ ḥ durdāntadamakaḥ pada tairokavijayī vīraḥ guhkarāṭ_ kulisyasvala, ||
msItem.explicit: [65v1, first codicological unit] śreyo mārgo visuddho yaṃ, māyājālamayoditaḥ gabhīrodā¦[65v2]lavipuro ṃ mahārtho jagadarthakṛt_ ḥ buddhānāṃ viyohyaya samyaksaṃbuddhabhāṣi[65v3]taḥ || ^^^ ||| iti upasaṃ%hāragāthāṃ pañca || 5 ||
msItem.finalRubric: [65v3, first codicological unit] āryyamāyājāra¦[65v4]ṣoḍaśasāhasrikāt_¦% mahājogatantrāntaḥpātisamādhirāja,paṭarā[65v5]paṭarā bhagavantaḥ tathāgataḥ śākamuṇibhāṣitāḥ bhagavanto mañjuśrījñāna[65v6]sattvasya, paramārthanāmasaṃgītiḥ parisamāpta || ^^^ ||
msItem.colophon: [65v6, first codicological unit] je dharmmā hetuprabhā[66r1, first codicological unit]vā,, hetutyakhā tathāgata || hevavades teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādi mahāśravana || @ || deyaṃ[66r2]dharmmo yaṃ pravarayāyina paramadhāmīkaśākyabhikṣuratnasihasya bhāryyāputraputrādināna,[66r3]sagaṇaparivārāṇāṃ | yad atra puṇya tad bhavat ācāryyāpadhyāya,,mātāpitṛpūrvvagamanaṃ kṛtvā,, [66r] sakarasatvarāśer anuttarajñānaṃ saṃpadaṃtu || mahārājādhirājaparameśvaraparamabhaṭṭā[66r5]raka,,rājarājendrakavindrajayapratāpamalladeya,, prabhūthākkurasya vijayarājye ḥ || śrīkā[66v1]ṣṭhamaṃṇḍapamahānagale,, maṃṇḍutora,, || taramudramahāvihārāvasthitta,,dānenapati,,dharmmātmā,,śā[66v2]kyabhikṣuśrīratnasiṃha naḥ utterāyanthacanane,, hnasaphetra savophāverasa,, manohaṣamāna[66v3] jasyaṃ,, tha mapadapanimistina,, || thva śaptavāra,, nāmaṃsaṃgītidayakā jaro || etapuṇyānu[66v4]bhāvena jayomānasya āñja ārāṇyajanadhanasaṃntānavṛddhir astu || śreyo stu samvat_78[66v5]3 taphorāthvaka,, daśamikundu,, saṃpūrṇṇa || jaro,, śubham astu sarvvadākāraṃ bhavaṃntu || śubha ||

msItem.title: Daśabalastavastotra
Daśabalastotra
Daśabalastava
Buddhabhaṭṭārakadaśabalastava
msItem.rubric: [67r1, first codicological unit] oṃ namo buddhāya ḥ
msItem.incipit: [67r1, first codicological unit] stutam api surasiṅghi siddhagandharvajakṣa, divi bhuvi suviciti tro¦[67r2]tabhāvi jatisya, aham api % kṛtaśakti, naumi sambauddham ājña nabhasi garuda yā[67r3]nti kṛrṣṇa yānti direphā || % 1 ||
msItem.explicit: [71v1, first codicological unit] ḥ yat puṃṇyaṃ samupāritaṃ, kharu mayā tene[71r2]va loko khikaṃ, pratyuti % harṣavalastava daśavare śraddhāmāriyāmāriyā || [71v3] || ^^^ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [71v3, first codicological unit] āryyaḥ śrībuddha%bhaṭṭarakasya, daśavalaṣṭavatrotaṃ samāptaḥ || [71v4] || ^^^ ||

physDesc.p: Composite manuscript consisting of two codicological units (The second codicological unit consists of replacement folios, numbered as 23-27, 30-34.).

supportDesc.foliation: Nepālākṣara numerals, mid-left margin, verso (Restarting from 1 for the Mañjuśrīnāmasaṅgīti, and absent for the Daśabalastavastotra).
supportDesc.condition: Incomplete, in good condition. The paper looks quite dirty, and sometimes worn out.

history.provenance:
Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright
in 1873-5.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 27 akṣaras per line.
layout.stringHole: One string hole, in the left part of the folio, framed by double marginal lines. It is approximately in the middle of 1 cm-wide blank space.

handNote.desc: First hand: Nepālākṣara script in black ink (Main text).
Second hand: Nepālākṣara script in black ink (Marginal corrections, and possibly annotations).

item.marginalia: Some marginal corrections throughout the manuscript.

layout.p: 6 lines per page, approximately 27 akṣaras per line.
